page.title: 13Transport and Travel
page.content: In Brightwalton it is important to have some kind of transport as public transport is poor.There are 157 cars and 8 Motor cycles and mopeds.Only{13 {households have no cars;37 have one {car;37 have two;9 have three or more {and 3 have four or}more.92 households have no{motor}cycles;6 have one and 1 {has two. 24}houses have{no garage; 47 {have one}garage;19 have two garages;{4 {houses}have{three}garages;2 have{four {garages and 3}have{five or more {garages. Newbury}is the{only town}that can be{reached by public transport. {There is only one bus service a {day.}If you miss the bus there is a {post bus}that you can catch.The {nearest railway station is at Newbury. There is a{good service to Reading and {London and to the South-West. Many {coaches}also{call at Newbury.
